com.github.codeteapot.jmibeans

Class PlatformEventQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.codeteapot.jmibeans.PlatformEventQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlatformEventSource

    public class PlatformEventQueue
extends Object
implements PlatformEventSource
    Implementation of PlatformEventSource based on an in-memory blocking queue.

    It serves as a reference to show the relationship between the event source and the PlatformListeners.

    • Constructor Summary

      Create a queue with default properties.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(PlatformListener listener)
        Add a new listener to the queue.

        A listener instance receives the same event as many times as it has been added to the queue. The order in which the added listeners receive the produced events is independent of the order in which they were added.

        The listener will only receive the events that have occurred since the moment it was added.

        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be added.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(PlatformListener listener)
        Removes the specified listener from the queue.

        Reverts the result of only one of the additions made to the queue.

        The listener will stop listening to the events that occur in the queue from the moment they have been removed as many times as they have been added.

        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be added.

      • dispatchEvents

        public void dispatchEvents()
                    throws InterruptedException
        Processes indefinitely and sequentially the events that are fired by the queue.

        Each event processed implies a call to the corresponding method of each added listener.

        This is a blocking operation. It does not support more than one concurrent execution on the same instance. Otherwise, the results are unexpected.

        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the dispatch thread is interrupted.
